info.title: PsychSignal
info.description: The most granular real time financial sentiment API in the world.

get.description: Returns alerts triggered on the system for the requested date range. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level. It can be stock specific and the date range is limited to 30 days.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. (Optional)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

get.description: Returns paginated alerts triggered on the system from most recent to oldest. It can be stock specific and it is limited to 100 alerts per request. It's also limited by your API level access.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of alerts to be returned. Max and default to 100 alerts. (Optional)

parameters.name: max_id
parameters.description: Alert ID. Alerts returned will be older than the specified id. (Optional)

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. (Optional)

get.description: Returns daily bullish / bearish messages volume ratio for a specific symbol. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the returned range. The date must be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. Defaults to MARKET. (optional)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the returned range. The date must be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

get.description: Returns daily bullish / bearish messages volume ratio for all symbols. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Specific date of the request. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Date can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

get.description: Returns the raw bullish and bearish values for a specific stock and specified date range aggregated by period. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Period of sentiments aggregation. It can be d for daily values or 2 for 2 minutes values. (Required)

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Stock symbol. Examples: AAPL, IBM, FB. For the aggregate of all market sentiment, use MARKET as symbol. (Required)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the returned range. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Range can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

get.description: Returns the raw bullish and bearish values for all stocks and specific date aggregated by period. Defaults to most recent data available for your API access level.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Specific date of the request. The date can be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Date can be modified depending on your API access level. (Optional)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format. Accepted output formats are json or csv. Defaults to JSON (Optional)

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Period of sentiments aggregation. It can be d for daily values or 2 for 2 minutes values. (Required)
